title: [K-12] Basics of Phytoplankton Community Analysis Using Satellite Remote Sensing

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic ecology and marine environmental concepts
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service teachers to acquire environment education methods integrated with social studies curricula, emphasizing hands-on learning with digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three impacts of phytoplankton on marine ecosystems.
Learners can understand the principles of phytoplankton analysis using satellite remote sensing technology.
Learners can design one or more remote sensing data interpretation activities applicable to primary and secondary education settings.
Learners can discuss the educational applicability of variational autoencoder (VAE)-based analytical models.

resources: Ocean color satellite data visualization tool

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
